I think that your problem is that you have installed a JRE on your
machine =
and this is what is referenced in your windows
registry.(HKEY_CURRENT_USERS=
->Software->Javasoft->Java Runtime
Environment) this is where the jre1.5.0_=
06\lib is found.
As you point out tools.jar is not part of this jre.
You ca=
n try 
option 1)adding the tools.jar file to the jre1.5.0_06\lib folder 
op=
tion 2)uninstalling the JRE and installing a JDK(JDK has the tool.jar)
opti=
on 3) changing the entry in the registry 
 



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com=
, "whitworthjanet" <janet.e.whitworth@...>
wrote:
